msContents.summary: F-95v: News of the Trinity, ዜና፡ ነገሮሙ፡ Arranged for days of the week: Monday (7v), Tuesday (19v), Wednesday (32v), Thursday (44r), Friday (57r), Saturday (74r), Sunday (85r), daily (87v). Cf. AbbCat 244, , Notice 106; StrLin 53 and 62; Textes 226–38.; EMML 1170 and EMIP 7. F-96v: a Prayer about the Keeper Angel, ጸሎት በእንተ መላከ ዑቃቤ, written in a later hand. F-98v: One Miracle of Jesus Christ. F-100v: One Miracle of Mary. F-101v: Instruction for Prayer in the Church. F-113r: Image of the Trinity, Mälk‘a Śǝllase, መልክአ፡ ሥላሴ፡, incomplete at the end. Répertoire 20; MG 189ff. Incipit : ሰላም: ለሕላዌክሙ: ዘይመውእ: ህላዌያተ:. F-115r: a Prayer to the Trinity. F-119v: Excerpts from the Horologium of Abba Giyorgis, arranged for the hours: Night (115r), morning (115v), third hour (116r), midday (116v), ninth hour (117v), evening (118r), bedtime (188v). F-124r: Sword of Divinity, Säyfä Mäläkot, ሠይፈ፡ መለኮት፡. Varia. F. i r(ecto): A poem about Sodom and Gomorrah, continued on , in red ink, and on in black ink. : Poem of the Good Shepherd. Notes. (as well as 31r and passim) mentions the owner, ገብረ ሚካኤል. A note of ownership on mentions the same owner, his brother, ስብሕ አምላክ, and his mother, ማርያማዊት. F. i v(erso)-ii r(ecto), top: Record: A Will designating the members of the family, witnesses and a judge. Bottom: Record: An agreement between a husband and wife mentioning the judge, and 9 Birr, etc. : Record of the birth of the owner's brother, ስቡሐ አምላክ, Teqemt 22, 1870, in the year of Mark the Evangelist, in the evening, on Wednesday. , col. 2: Record of the birth of one, ሥዩም, in the year 1871, in the year of Luke the Evangelist, in the month Sane, on a Tuesday, the 17th night and 3rd day, in the morning. : Geneological note. : Record of an Adoption of a girl, በለጥሻቸው ወርቄ, in 1897EC, in the year of Matthew the Evangelist, in the month of Hamle, on the 8th day. It mentions witnesses (several high-ranking officials), and a judge. : Record of the transfer of position to manage the property of the church, from one priest to another. In 1902EC, in the year of Mark the Evangelist, Hedar 21. There is a list of witnesses and a judge.
